author: sky.cactus
content: I don't think 4488/4490 are trying to "subsidize rollups".  They are correcting an over-pricing of calldata.  Calldata was priced to limit maximum block size, long-term calldata storage costs, and network bandwidth costs on client operators.  This correction, if included with something like EIP-4444 and 4488, introduces new mitigations for the first two of those costs which allows us to price mostly based on the fourth cost.

author: 0xraino
content: Don't call people's questions stupid. When others see that it makes them less likely to ask their questions, even if their questions are good and worthwhile.

author: 0xraino
content: Although the confusion is natural because a few core devs were calling it a "subsidy". I personally don't think we should continue with the subsidy framing because, as you mentioned, some form of history pruning on the horizon is what makes this viable.
